title: UN at 80: Ellora caves host global cultural celebration with artists from 7 nations
content: As the United Nations marks 80 years, a rare cultural celebration unfolded at the Ellora Caves in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar. From classical and fusion performances to recreated historic concerts and heritage tours, artists and dignitaries from over 35 countries came together at the Kailasa temple to celebrate shared values of culture, spirituality, and peaceful coexistence. The event highlighted Ajanta and Ellora as India‚Äôs first UNESCO World Heritage Sites and showcased India‚Äôs living cultural heritage on a global stage.

title: How Indian States are following a pro-incumbency trend

The jurisdiction of PIL could not be invoked based on generalised claims without naming affected persons, challenging specific orders or placing verifiable material on record

content: The couple had married in 2011, but had been living separately for the past one-and-a-half years due to marital discord

content: The video caught the attention of local authorities. The Police from Pilkhuwa Kotwali filed a traffic violation case and issued a fine of Rs 31,000 for the reckless ride.

title: Pawan Kalyan Visits Village Where Jana Sena Workers' Houses Were Demolished
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan on Wednesday visited Tadepalli mandal in Guntur district, fulfilling a promise he had made before the elections almost two years ago.

title: Mid-Air Emergency Activates 'Garmin Autoland', US Plane Lands Itself
content: A small airplane landed safely on its own, using a special autopilot system called Garmin Autoland, after an in-flight emergency in Colorado, US.

title: Tribe Names In ST Certificates Of Some Manipur Government Staff Don't Exist In Official List: RTI
content: The Scheduled Tribes (ST) certificates of some employees in Manipur government departments have names of tribes that do not exist in the state's official list of ST cleared by parliament, according to information obtained via the RTI Act.

title: "Politically Motivated": Mehbooba Mufti's Plea On Prisoners Rejected
content: The Court emphasised that the public interest litigation is not a tool for advancing political agendas or turning the judiciary into a political arena.

title: "Mummy, Don't Want To Waste Money": BTech Student Dies By Suicide In Noida
content: A first-year engineering student has died by suicide at a hostel in Greater Noida, leaving behind a note that says he did not want his parents to waste more money on his education.

title: H-1B Visa FAQs: All About Team Trump's Wage Policy, How It May Affect Indians
content: In a significant H-1B visa policy overhaul, the Trump administration in the United States is replacing the random lottery system that selected beneficiaries with a process that gives greater weight to those with higher skills and who are better paid.

title: Watch: India Test Fires Next-Generation Akash Missile System
content: In a big boost to the Indian armed forces, key trials of the next-generation Akash missile (Akash-NG) have been completed.

title: US Judge Upholds Trump's $100K H-1B Visa Fee Amid Immigration Crackdown
content: A US federal judge on Tuesday upheld President Donald Trump's $100,000 fee to process H-1B visa applications, acknowledging it could "inflict significant harm on American businesses and institutions of higher education."

title: US Says China's Semiconductor Policies Are Unfair But Delays Tariffs To 2027
content: US trade officials determined that China should be punished for employing unfair tactics to dominate the semiconductor industry, but will wait 18 months to impose tariffs, American authorities said Tuesday.

title: "The Vlog... Is Over": YouTuber Adam The Woo Shared Holiday Video Before Death
content: YouTuber and travel vlogger Adam Williams, popularly known as Adam the Woo, left fans in shock after posting a cheerful holiday video just a day before his body was discovered at his Florida home.

title: Girl, 6, Dies A Month After Dog Bite Despite Treatment In Maharashtra
content: A six-year-old girl from Maharashtra's Thane died over a month after being bitten by a street dog, a civic official said on Wednesday.

title: 'I Stay In Delhi For 2 Days, Get Infection': Nitin Gadkari Flags Toxic Air
content: Delhi's toxic air has drawn strong remarks from within the ruling BJP, with Union Minister Nitin Gadkari saying that two days in the national capital gives him an infection.

title: 2 Days After Russian General's Assassination, 2 Cops Killed Near Moscow Site
content: Three people were killed by a bomb on Wednesday in Moscow after two police officers approached a man acting suspiciously near the site where a senior general was killed two days ago by a car bomb that Russia said was planted by Ukraine.

title: Telangana Shocker: Official's Assets Estimated To Be Over 100 Crores
content: The Telangana Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has registered a case against the deputy transport commissioner of Mahabubnagar district for possessing assets wildly disproportionate to his known sources of income.

title: Co-Conspirators To Mentions Of Trump, What Latest Jeffrey Epstein Files Say
content: The latest Jeffrey Epstein documents reveal that investigators were exploring charges against those beyond Epstein and his former partner, Ghislaine Maxwell. Emails from July 2019 mention "10 co-conspirators."

title: Split In Opposition In Mumbai Civic Polls, Main Parties To Contest Separately
content: The opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in Maharashtra, which fought last year's Lok Sabha elections and the Assembly elections together, has now gone for a split in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Is Congress Looking At A Rahul-Priyanka-Sachin Pilot Troika For 2029?
content: The Congress is undergoing a big churn that may see a meatier and bigger role for Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

title: Army Officer Dies In Firing Inside Military Camp In J&K
content: A junior Commissioned Officer of the army has been killed in a firing incident inside an army camp in Samba district of Jammu and Kashmir. An investigation has been launched to ascertain the nature of the firing incident.

title: Cousins Uddhav Thackeray, Raj To Make Reunion Official Shortly
content: Uddhav Thackeray's faction of Shiv Sena is going ahead full steam with Raj Thackeray's MNS for the civic elections in Mumbai.

title: 'Arunachal now China's core interest': US flags Beijing's 'rejuvenation' plan; what is it
content: A Pentagon report reveals China's inclusion of Arunachal Pradesh as a "core interest" alongside Taiwan and maritime disputes, integral to its 2049 rejuvenation goal. While India and China agreed to disengage from LAC standoff points, mutual distrust is expected to persist, with Beijing also deepening military ties with Pakistan.

title: Odisha shocker: Minor girl ‚Äòraped and murdered‚Äô; body found in jungle
content: A 10-year-old girl was found dead in a jungle in Bhadrak district. She had gone to school and did not return home. Family members found her body and filed a police complaint. Police are investigating the case as assault and murder. Angry locals blocked the highway demanding justice for the victim.

title: Delhi Metro expansion: Cabinet clears Phase-VA - all you need to know
content: The Union Cabinet has greenlit Delhi Metro's Phase-VA, adding 13 new stations and over 16 km to the network. This Rs 12,015 crore expansion, slated for completion in three years, will push the total operational length beyond 400 km.

title: Amazon security chief reveals how ‚Äòsmall details‚Äô exposed North Korean agents
content: Amazon has thwarted over 1800 North Korean operatives from applying for tech jobs in the last 20 months.  These individuals aimed to funnel wages back to fund the regime's weapons programs.  The company employs AI screening and human verification to detect fraudulent applicants, highlighting a growing industry-wide threat.

title: 'Two days in Delhi, I get infection‚Äô: Gadkari flags severity of air pollution; highlights fossil fuel use
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari highlighted Delhi's severe air pollution, attributing 40% to the transport sector's reliance on fossil fuels. He urged a shift to electric and hydrogen mobility, framing it as a nationalistic imperative to reduce costly imports and pollution. Gadkari emphasised India's potential for cleaner fuel alternatives and advancements in electric vehicle technology.

title: Vinod Kumar Shukla, first Jnanpith awardee from Chhattisgarh, dies at 88
content: Renowned Hindi writer Vinod Kumar Shukla passed away at 88 after a lung ailment. The first Jnanpith awardee from Chhattisgarh, Shukla was known for his quiet grace and focus on ordinary people's inner worlds. He continued writing even in the ICU, leaving behind a legacy of profound literature.

title: 'Kicked her in stomach': Man assaults pregnant woman while celebrating Jagan Reddy's birthday
content: A man in Sri Sathya Sai district was arrested and paraded for allegedly assaulting a six-month pregnant woman. The incident occurred when the woman objected to loud cracker bursting during a birthday celebration. Police have registered a case and emphasized strict action against crimes targeting women and children.

title: Vince & Linda McMahon net worth in 2025: WWE earnings, careers and investments
content: Wrestling titans Vince and Linda McMahon boast a $3.2 billion net worth in 2025, largely from their WWE empire and TKO Group Holdings shares. Vince's legacy in transforming wrestling is undeniable, while Linda also carved a significant business and political path. Despite recent legal challenges for Vince, their financial success endures.

title: Unnao rape survivor‚Äôs mother blocked from protest; claims daughter is 'held captive'
content: Security personnel in Delhi reportedly stopped an Unnao rape survivor and her mother from protesting at India Gate. The duo were demonstrating against the Delhi High Court's decision to grant relief to former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar. The victim's mother expressed distress, stating they were not granted justice and feared for their safety.

title: ‚ÄòYou are wrong‚Äô: Ex-ASML engineer build EUV machine; contradicts CEO‚Äôs timeline
content: China has reportedly built a working prototype of an advanced chip-making machine, defying Western predictions.  Former ASML engineers are said to be behind the project, which aims for semiconductor independence. This development, a six-year government initiative, could significantly alter global chip supply chains, challenging ASML's monopoly on crucial EUV technology.

title: 'Won't bow down': Thackeray cousins reunite after 20yrs for BMC polls; present united front
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS have announced an alliance for upcoming BMC and other civic body elections, marking a political reunion of Thackeray cousins Uddhav and Raj. Seat-sharing agreements have been finalized, with the NCP (SP) also included in some discussions. This move is seen as a significant development in Maharashtra politics.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to deterministic automation in its Agentforce product. Executives acknowledge a decline in trust in AI models, with reported instances of models omitting instructions and losing focus. This strategic pivot follows significant support staff reductions attributed to AI agent deployment.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce‚Äôs apology after Chiefs‚Äô playoff exit
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Who is Brittani? Inside Aaron Rodgers‚Äô wife as marriage mystery deepens
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: Shane McMahon and Marissa Mazzola‚Äôs combined net worth in 2025
content: Shane and Marissa Mazzola-McMahon possess a combined net worth of $650 million, largely attributed to Shane's decades with WWE and his diversified business ventures. While Shane's wealth stems from his executive roles, on-camera presence, and equity in WWE, Marissa's career in film production and PR augments their family fortune.

title: World record in Ranchi! Bihar smash highest-ever List A total; Sakibul Gani hits fastest 100
content: Bihar shattered List A cricket history, posting a world-record 574/6 against Arunachal Pradesh. Captain Sakibul Gani hit the fastest Indian List A century (32 balls), while 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed 190 off 84 balls, becoming the youngest List A centurion ever. Ayush Loharuka also contributed a century in the dominant batting display.

title: VHT: 16,000 and counting! Virat Kohli enters elite List A club with Sachin Tendulkar
content: Virat Kohli achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second Indian after Sachin Tendulkar to surpass 16,000 List A runs during the Vijay Hazare Trophy. His return to domestic cricket also serves as crucial preparation for India's upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.

title: Moscow car blast: Two police officers, one civilian killed; Russia blames Ukraine
content: Moscow was rocked by a deadly explosion Wednesday, claiming the lives of two police officers and a bystander. The blast occurred as officers approached a suspicious individual. This incident follows a similar car bomb attack on a senior Russian military officer earlier this week in the same district, raising security alarms in the capital.

title: Crackdown on corruption: Telangana official arrested with Rs 12 cr disproportionate assets
content: A deputy transport commissioner in Mahabubnagar, identified as Kishan, has been arrested by the ACB for amassing assets worth an estimated ‚Çπ12 crore, significantly exceeding his known income. His extensive holdings include hotel shares, commercial and agricultural land, flats, bank deposits, and gold. Investigations are ongoing to ascertain the full extent of his wealth.

title: 'Wanted to kill myself': Unnao rape survivor protests Kuldeep Sengar bail; calls it 'injustice'
content: Unnao rape survivor protested at India Gate after Kuldeep Singh Sengar's bail, fearing for her safety and alleging political motives linked to upcoming elections. She expressed betrayal by the system but retained faith in the Supreme Court. Sengar's bail was suspended pending appeal, though he remains in custody due to a separate conviction.

title: 'You had Osman Hadi killed': Kin makes big claim against Yunus; alleges plot to 'sabotage' polls
content: The brother of slain youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi accused Bangladesh‚Äôs interim government of orchestrating his killing to destabilise the country and sabotage the February elections. Speaking at protests in Dhaka, he said Hadi was targeted for supporting timely polls and refusing outside pressure, warning of continued agitation unless swift justice is delivered.

title: VHT: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi becomes youngest centurion; smashes 36-ball hundred
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi has electrified the Vijay Hazare Trophy, smashing a 36-ball century against Arunachal Pradesh on Wednesday. This remarkable feat makes him the youngest List-A centurion ever.  The young prodigy's explosive batting, including a conversion to 150 in 59 balls, signals a potential shift in Indian domestic cricket's landscape.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office day 20: Ranveer Singh starrer expected to touch Rs 600 cr
content: Dhurandhar is enjoying a phenomenal box office run. The film has broken records and is set to become the highest-grossing Hindi film. It is expected to cross Rs 600 crore by the end of its third week. With few major releases, Dhurandhar is well-placed for a sustained theatrical run. It is on course to overtake Pushpa 2's collection.

title: Indian woman murdered in Toronto: Suspect identified, image released; what we know so far
content: Toronto police are searching for Abdul Ghafoori, the main suspect in the murder of 30-year-old Indian national Himanshi Khurana. Her body was discovered in a residence near Strachan Avenue and Wellington Street West. Authorities are treating the incident as intimate partner violence, and a Canada-wide warrant has been issued for Ghafoori's arrest.

title: ‚ÄòGroped, slapped, stalked‚Äô: Man assaults woman after she rejects his proposal; CCTV captures attack
content: A 21-year-old woman was stalked and assaulted by a man she met on Instagram in Bengaluru. The accused, Naveen Kumar, allegedly harassed her after she rejected his advances. He intercepted her and attacked her, leading to his arrest by Jnanabharathi police.

title: Exclusive | Naseem Shah on criticism: 'Fans have never held a ball... you don't take it to heart'
content: Pakistan fast bowler Naseem Shah reflects on the challenges of T20 cricket, his journey through injuries and scrutiny, and his current positive outlook with the Desert Vipers in the ILT20. He emphasises on continuous learning, mental resilience against criticism, and the unique difficulties faced by bowlers in a batter-dominated era.

title: ‚ÄòDiscuss atrocities against minorities‚Äô: Jamia suspends professor; orders probe over exam question
content: Jamia Millia Islamia University has suspended a faculty member from its Social Work department following complaints about an end-semester examination paper. The paper, titled "Social Problems in India," faced criticism on social media for alleged ideological bias and a one-sided narrative. An inquiry committee has been formed to investigate the matter.

title: ‚ÄòCompletely unfit‚Äô: Humayun Kabir removes influencer from candidate list; explains why
content: Janata Unnayan Party's Ballygunge candidate Nisha Chatterjee was dropped by MLA Humayun Kabir within 24 hours due to "inappropriate social media posts." Chatterjee, a social media influencer, has threatened legal action for defamation, accusing Kabir of a "sham" secular party promise and attempting to divide communities.

title: Bank holiday Christmas: Will banks remain shut today & tomorrow? - check state-wise list
content: Confused about bank operations this Christmas? While Christmas Day sees nationwide closures, Christmas Eve is a holiday only in Mizoram, Nagaland, and Meghalaya. Other state-specific holidays also affect banking. Plan ahead for branch visits, as digital services remain accessible. Check local lists to avoid festive season disruptions.

title: 'Deflating tyres of bicycles': Principal‚Äôs orders senior students to beat Class 7 boy; booked
content: A Kompally government school principal faces a criminal case for allegedly ordering four Class 10 students to assault a Class 7 boy. The victim, who sustained back injuries, reported the incident to his parents, leading to a police complaint. Authorities suspect the principal believed the younger student deflated bicycle tires in the parking lot. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Wellness Wednesday: Social media myth buster- 'more protein is always better'
content: Social media's protein obsession is misleading. Experts clarify that excessive protein intake offers no extra benefits and can strain kidneys, especially for those with existing health issues.  Balanced nutrition, not extremes, is key.  Regular exercise is crucial for the body to effectively utilize protein for muscle repair and growth, ensuring overall well-being.

title: Illicit affair, hired shooter: How woman gave ‚Äòsupari‚Äô to kill husband; body dumped near expressway
content: Dausa police have arrested a 35-year-old woman, Shweta alias Shilpi Sharma, for orchestrating the contract killing of her husband. The investigation, triggered by the discovery of an unidentified body, revealed the murder was motivated by an illicit relationship. The main conspirator and hired killer are also in custody.

title: 7 ways the human body reacts in life or death situations
content: Life or death situations trigger automatic survival responses. The body prioritizes escape and defense, overriding comfort and logic. Adrenaline and stress hormones reorganize brain activity, enhancing threat detection. This leads to altered time perception, suppressed pain, narrowed vision, and temporary strength. Memories become fragmented, and shaking may follow. These involuntary reactions are the body's fight for survival.

title: Will AI take our jobs, or is the bubble about to burst? Here‚Äôs what the Salesforce story tells us
content: Rising fears about AI-driven job losses are colliding with a more complex reality. Using Salesforce as a case study, the story examines how early confidence in large language models has given way to concerns over reliability, accountability, and trust. The company‚Äôs layoffs and subsequent pullback from AI-first rhetoric reveal that automation is reshaping work unevenly, exposing organisational choices as much as technological limits.

title: Internet suspended, curfew imposed: What triggered unrest in Assam's Karbi Anglong
content: Violent protests over alleged illegal non-tribal settlements in Assam's Karbi Anglong region have resulted in two deaths and dozens injured. Tensions over land rights escalated, leading to clashes between tribal protesters and security forces. The state government has imposed restrictions and suspended mobile internet services.

title: Watch: Group of men harass street vendors selling Santa caps; video goes viral
content: Police are investigating a viral video depicting men intimidating street vendors selling Santa hats in Puri. The men questioned the vendors' origins and religion, demanding they cease selling festive items and suggesting they sell religious merchandise instead. The incident has sparked outrage online, with many condemning it as an attack on communal harmony.

title: 'India continues to soar higher': PM hails Isro's BlueBird Block-2 satellite launch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded Isro's successful launch of the US communications satellite BlueBird Block-2, calling it a proud milestone for India's space sector. The LVM3 rocket, carrying the heaviest satellite launched from Indian soil, demonstrated India's heavy-lift capability and commitment to self-reliance, strengthening its global commercial launch market role.

title: Ashes hangover? ECB probes England players' drinking after videos surface ‚Äì watch
content: England's cricket chief Rob Key is investigating reports of excessive player drinking during the Ashes tour's mid-series break. Videos emerged showing Ben Duckett appearing disoriented and Jacob Bethell in a nightclub. While Key stated he expects responsible behavior, initial feedback suggests players were well-behaved, with only occasional drinks.  He emphasised that over-indulgence would be addressed.

title: 'Policy decision': US judge refuses to scrap Trump‚Äôs $100,000 H-1B visa fee
content: A US federal judge upheld the Trump administration's $100,000 fee on new H-1B visas, rejecting a lawsuit by the Chamber of Commerce. The judge ruled President Trump had the legal authority to impose the fee, citing concerns that the program was displacing American workers. This decision impacts tech companies and businesses relying on skilled foreign talent.

title: Clayton Kershaw and wife welcome fifth baby, Chloe Peach
content: the former los Angeles Dodgers pitcher announced he will retire at the end of the 2025 season . he shared a post with his new daughter, Chloe Peach Kershaw, alongside his wife and four children . the three-time world series champion announced during an interview on the "Sunday Night Baseball" broadcast on June 15 .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: From Lane Kiffin to Pat Fitzgerald, we rank every FBS coaching hire
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the Wisconsin head coaching job .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Sieh Bangura carries Ohio to seventh straight bowl win
content: Ohio RB Sieh Bangura rushed 23 yards for a touchdown to widen the Bobcats' lead . the 2025 bowl season is in full swing and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances . we'll pick MVPs from each game from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 .

title: Wait, no Jordan Love? The biggest Pro Bowl snubs for the AFC and NFC rosters
content: there are always a few standout players who should make the Pro Bowl . the snubs aren't named to the initial AFC and NFC rosters . a handful of players may be disappointed to not make the AFC or NFC teams .

title: 2026 NFL Pro Bowl AFC, NFC rosters: The league's top players
content: the rosters are set for the 2026 NFL Pro Bowl Games . the Baltimore Ravens, Denver Broncos , San Francisco 49ers and Seattle Seahawks lead the way with each having six players chosen . this year's games include a skills competition and a 7-on-7 flag football game scheduled for Feb. 3 .

title: What has gone wrong for four teams trying to make the playoffs?
content: the Lions, Chargers and Bills all clinched with the Colts' loss . we entered the slate with two guaranteed playoff teams, and we leave it with 10 . this column comes to you every Tuesday, though, as we reset our content .

title: The 25 most college football moments of the 21st century
content: college football slips so easily into pure chaos after all the on-field heroics . college football is a celebration not of the sublime but of the ridiculous . it has to be a little bit weird, colorless, color-coded moment .

title: Metcalf's 2-game ban upheld, will forfeit $555K
content: dK Metcalf will sit out the final two games of the regular season . he will forfeit $555,556 in salary . the suspension also voids $45 million in future guaranteed money, according to his contract .

title: The budding Spurs-Thunder rivalry that could shape the future of the West
content: wemby believes he's the best overall player in the league . the defending champions had snapped their 16-game winning streak in the most high-stakes game of the season . wembanyama has had a frosty competitive relationship with 'chet Holmgren' .
